definition: to face childbirth/about to give birth/refers esp. to the onset of regular contractions
to face/to overlook/to arrive/to be (just) about to/just before

sentences.english: When the aura of birth or plan to dismantle suture cesarean section.
sentences.chinese: 当出现了临产先兆或计划施行剖宫产时再拆除缝线。

sentences.english: A few weeks before my due date, Mother lapsed into a deep coma.
sentences.chinese: 就在我临产的前几周，妈妈陷入了深度昏迷。

sentences.english: Your baby will be continuously monitored to assess how he or she is dealing with labor.
sentences.chinese: 你的宝宝将会被继续监视并评估如何应对临产。

sentences.english: You should hurry because one of us is about to have a baby.
sentences.chinese: 你们要尽快赶来，因为我们当中有个孕妇要临产了。

sentences.english: Did not know that has mother to experience before being in labor, the fetal membrane bursts early.
sentences.chinese: 不知道有没有妈妈经历过在临产前，胎膜早破裂。

sentences.english: Before being in labor, will present the childbirth omen.
sentences.chinese: 临产前就会出现分娩先兆。

sentences.english: Many expectant mothers were crowded out of the maternity hospitals.
sentences.chinese: 很多临产妇女由于孕妇过多而被妇产医院拒之门外。

sentences.english: At the same time, to talk about small love also showed signs of labor, in the same hospital.
sentences.chinese: 与此同时，谈小爱也出现临产迹象，进了同一家医院。

sentences.english: But it doesn’t sound like your labor’s fitting that typical first-timer pattern.
sentences.chinese: 但是听起来你的临产符合典型的初产模式。

definition: (of an expectant mother) to be in labor
expected date of childbirth/estimated due date (EDD)
to become pregnant/to carry a child in the womb
woman recuperating after childbirth/woman in childbirth
